title: 💡 Web Development Tips for Beginners
intro: Essential tips and best practices for new web developers to avoid common mistakes and accelerate your learning.

sections.subtitle: 📝 Write Clean Code
tips: Use meaningful variable names - `userAge` instead of `x`
Keep functions small - One function, one purpose
Comment your code - Explain the "why", not the "what"
Consistent formatting - Use prettier or similar tools

tips.text: Use Version Control - Commit early and often
Test Your Code - Write tests for critical functions
Mobile First - Design for mobile devices first
Optimize Performance - Compress images, minify code

dontDo.solution: Always include alt text for images

doThis.description: HTML for structure, CSS for style, JS for behavior
Start with basic functionality, add features

designUX.title: 🎨 Design & UX Tips

userExperience.description: Don't overwhelm users with too many options
Same menu structure across all pages
Users will leave if it takes too long
Make it obvious what you want users to do

debugging.title: 🔧 Debugging Tips
findingBugs: Use console.log() - Debug JavaScript step by step
Browser DevTools - Inspect elements and network requests
Validate your HTML - Use W3C validator
Check for typos - Simple mistakes cause big problems

tools.name: VS Code Debugger
tools.description: Step through your code line by line

tools.name: Linting Tools
tools.description: ESLint for JavaScript, Stylelint for CSS

careerTips.title: 🎯 Career Tips
portfolio: Showcase your best work - Quality over quantity
Include live demos - Let people interact with your projects
Write case studies - Explain your problem-solving process
Keep it updated - Add new projects regularly
firstJob: Build real projects - Not just tutorial follow-alongs
Contribute to open source - Shows collaboration skills
Network with other developers - Many jobs come through connections
Practice coding interviews - LeetCode, HackerRank, etc.

proTip: Every expert was once a beginner. Don't be afraid to make mistakes - they're part of the learning process!

finalTips.text: Focus on fundamentals - HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are crucial
Code every day - Even 30 minutes helps build consistency
Help others - Teaching reinforces your own learning
Stay curious - Technology changes fast, keep learning
Celebrate small wins - Acknowledge your progress
